message: Me, what do you want to know?
Me too. Awesome experience and I normally suck at sys admin stuff. What do you want to know?
are you using shared database? how do you access database since psql is not enabled on shared databases?
What? I access it the normal way, Heroku automatically attaches a database setting to your settings.py so everything should work from start.
How do you get your local postgre to work? Do you need a separate settings file locally?

@Riku Ok, I just edited the settings file with normal settings for a local postgre and it seems to work. Somehow Heroku overrides these settings? Sorry for thinking outloud here, probably not the right questions but I might be able to help on deploying to Heroku.
@peppelorum psql has nothing to do with how django accesses db
local postgre to work? Not sure what you mean. I use the Heroku supplied one you find at http://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/django#postgres_database_config

@Riku yes, you have your local postgresql settings using your local database, and heroku overrides that part of your settings file to work with their database. Actually they just announced that you can use their postgresql databases for any app you want, they built an external service.
